sprout.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if vegetables, seeds, or plants sprout, they start to grow, producing shoots, buds, or leaves
sprout.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Move the pots outside when the seeds begin to sprout.
Trees were starting to sprout new leaves.
sprout.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to appear suddenly in large numbers
sprout.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Office blocks are sprouting up everywhere.
sprout.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if something such as hair sprouts or if you sprout it, it starts to grow
sprout.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Jim seemed to have sprouted a beard.
sprout.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a small green vegetable like a very small cabbage
sprout.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a new growth on a plant
sprout.translation[1].definitions[2].def: an alfalfa seed which has grown a stem and is eaten
